criteria: Accuracy of Graphing Exponential and Logarithmic Functions
Identification and Labeling of Key Features
descriptions: The student does not attempt to graph exponential or logarithmic functions, or the attempt shows no understanding of the functions' basic shapes.
The student attempts to graph the functions but makes significant errors in plotting points or identifying key features such as intercepts.
The student graphs the functions with some errors in plotting points or identifying intercepts. The overall shape of the graph is recognizable but not accurate.
The student accurately graphs either an exponential or a logarithmic function, showing intercepts and a generally correct shape, but struggles with the other function type.
The student accurately graphs both exponential and logarithmic functions, showing intercepts and generally correct shapes, but may have minor errors in scaling or labeling.
The student precisely graphs both exponential and logarithmic functions, correctly showing intercepts, end behavior, and accurate scaling. Graphs are clear and well-labeled.
The student does not attempt to graph trigonometric functions, or the attempt shows no understanding of the functions' periodic nature.
The student attempts to graph trigonometric functions but makes significant errors in plotting points or identifying key features such as period, midline, or amplitude.
The student graphs trigonometric functions with some errors in plotting points or identifying key features. The periodic nature of the graph is recognizable but not accurate.
The student accurately graphs one trigonometric function (sine, cosine, or tangent), showing period, midline, and amplitude, but struggles with the other function types.
The student accurately graphs multiple trigonometric functions, showing period, midline, and amplitude, but may have minor errors in scaling or labeling.

The student precisely graphs trigonometric functions, correctly showing period, midline, amplitude, and accurate scaling. Graphs are clear, well-labeled, and demonstrate a strong understanding of trigonometric behavior.
The student does not identify or label any key features of the graphs.
The student attempts to identify key features but misidentifies or incorrectly labels them.
The student identifies some key features but misses others or provides incomplete labeling.
The student identifies and labels most key features of the graphs, such as intercepts, period, midline, and amplitude, with minor errors.
The student correctly identifies and labels all key features of the graphs, but the presentation may lack clarity.
The student precisely identifies and clearly labels all key features of the graphs, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding of their significance.
